summary: Garter snakes, part of the Thamnophis genus, are small to medium-sized snakes found across North and Central America. There are about 35 different species, which vary in color and pattern, often featuring stripes and spots. They have distinctive round eyes and a slender body. Garter snakes can range in length from 18 to 51 inches. While they are both venomous and poisonous, their venom and toxins are harmless to humans. Their poisonous nature comes from their diet, mainly poisonous frogs.
title: Garter snake
